attributes.action: disqualify people from driving any vehicle for life if they are convicted of death by dangerous driving in any form as an alternative to imprisonment.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Driving is a privilege, not a right and privileges can and must be removed when appropriate.
The reason for this punishment is that the life of a person has been taken and a suitable punishment must be given. Imprisonment not only punishes the person who committed the crime but also of their family who are more often than not innocent parties. When the imprisonment is over the person can then drive again and carry on as normal. Never being able to drive again will be a constant reminder of their crime probably reinforced by those that it effects.

Driving whilst banned should carry a severe sentence of incarceration and destruction of any vehicle they are diving as a deterrent.
